docs.title: Count App
docs.text:
A powerful, extensible counter tracking application for Android, Windows, Linux and macOS

Track counts and numeric series effortlessly with a beautiful, intuitive interface. Whether you're counting daily habits, monitoring body metrics, or tracking business data, Count App provides the tools you need.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Clean and Modern UI

    A sleek, user-friendly interface designed for quick updates and easy navigation.

  • Multiple Counter Types

    Choose between Tap Counters for quick counting and Series Counters for trend tracking over time.

  • Rich Statistics

    Interactive charts, averages, highs/lows, and flexible time-range filtering (1W, 1M, 3M, 1Y, All).

  • Leaderboards

    Compete with friends and family by joining shared leaderboards with 6-character codes.

  • Beautiful Themes

    Modern design with automatic dark/light theme support that adapts to your system preferences.

  • Data Control

    Full JSON export/import for backups and data portability. Your data stays under your control.

docs.text:

docs.text:

docs.text:
Perfect for: Tracking values that change over time

  • Use cases: Body weight, daily revenue, temperature logs, stock prices

Learn more about counter types →

docs.title: For Developers
docs.text:
Welcome developers! Here's how to get started:

  • Development Setup - Set up your local environment

Latest Release

Version 1.5.7 is now available! Visit the GitHub releases page to download.

docs.title: Development setup (using dev branch)
docs.text:
This page describes how to set up a local development environment using the dev branch.

Note

The Releases page contains pre-built APKs and platform binaries for users. The development guide below is for contributors or for building locally.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Flutter SDK (stable channel recommended): https://docs.flutter.dev/get-started/install
  • Dart SDK (bundled with Flutter)
  • Git

docs.title: Clone the dev branch
docs.text:
You can clone the dev branch directly to avoid an extra checkout step:

git clone -b dev --single-branch https://github.com/KingBenny101/countapp.git
cd countapp

Keeping on dev lets you work on the latest in-progress features and tests.

docs.title: Install dependencies
docs.text: flutter pub get

docs.title: Initial setup — generate environment (run once)
docs.text:
Before running the app for the first time, run the environment generator which sets up icons and other assets. This only needs to be run once after cloning or when those resources change.

dart run tool/build.dart generate

docs.title: Generate code (Hive adapters)
docs.text: dart run build_runner build --delete-conflicting-outputs

docs.title: Run locally
docs.text:
• Run the app for your target platform with flutter run (desktop or device):
flutter run

docs.title: Build release artifacts
docs.text: Count App provides a helper build script and standard Flutter build commands to produce release artifacts for each platform.

docs.title: Build script
docs.text:
The project includes tool/build.dart which wraps common tasks. Note that the all command builds for the current platform and Android (it does not build every possible platform).

# Generate environment (icons, package config) — run once after cloning
dart run tool/build.dart generate

# Clean build artifacts
dart run tool/build.dart clean

# Build for Android
dart run tool/build.dart build_android

# Build for Windows (requires Windows host)
dart run tool/build.dart build_windows

# Build for Linux
dart run tool/build.dart build_linux

# Build for macOS (requires macOS host)
dart run tool/build.dart build_macos

# Build 'all' (current platform + Android)
dart run tool/build.dart all

docs.title: Output
docs.text:
• release/countapp-{version}.apk (Android)
  • release/windows/countapp/ (Windows executable + deps)
  • release/linux/countapp/ (Linux executable + deps)

docs.title: Version management
docs.text:
Set version in pubspec.yaml:

version: 1.4.0 # MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH

The build script extracts the version and names output files accordingly.

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text:
• If code generation fails, run flutter clean and re-run build_runner.
  • If you see platform-specific permission or plugin errors on desktop, search the project issues or open a new issue with logs.

Helpful tips:

  • Keep your local dev branch rebased on top of origin/dev regularly.
  • Run flutter analyze and dart format . before opening PRs.

docs.title: Installation Guide
docs.text:
Download and install Count App on your device using the pre-built packages from the official releases page.

Downloads

All releases are available on the GitHub Releases page.

docs.title: Android (apk)
docs.text:
1. Download the latest .apk from the Releases page.
  2. On your device, allow installation from unknown sources (Settings → Security) if required.
  3. Open the downloaded file and follow the prompts to install.

Alternative (adb): 

adb install -r countapp-1.5.7.apk

docs.title: Windows (zip)
docs.text:
1. Download the Windows .zip file from the Releases page.
  2. Extract the zip file to a folder of your choice.
  3. Run countapp.exe.

Windows Defender

Windows might prevent the app from starting because it's unsigned. Click "More info" → "Run anyway" to proceed.

docs.title: macOS (.app)
docs.text:
1. Download the macOS .zip file from the Releases page.
  2. Extract the zip file to get Count App.app.
  3. Drag Count App.app to your Applications folder.
  4. Double-click to launch.

Security Warning

On first launch, macOS may block the app. Control-click (right-click) the app icon and select "Open" from the menu, then click "Open" in the dialog box.

docs.title: Linux (tar.gz)
docs.text:
1. Download the Linux tar.gz file.
  2. Extract the tarball: 
    tar -xzf countapp-1.5.7-linux.tar.gz
cd countapp
  3. Run the application: 
    chmod +x countapp  # If needed
./countapp

docs.title: Android: "App not installed"
docs.text:
Possible causes: - Unknown sources not enabled - Insufficient storage space - Conflicting app signature

Solutions: 1. Enable installation from unknown sources: - Go to Settings → Security - Enable "Unknown sources" or "Install unknown apps" 2. Free up storage space (need at least 50MB) 3. Uninstall any previous versions first

docs.title: Android: "Parse error"
docs.text:
Possible causes: - Corrupted download - Incompatible device architecture

Solutions: 1. Re-download the APK file 2. Verify your device architecture matches (ARM/ARM64) 3. Check Android version meets minimum requirement (5.0+)

docs.title: Windows: "Windows protected your PC"
docs.text:
This is normal for unsigned applications.

Solution: 1. Click "More info" 2. Click "Run anyway" 3. The app will launch normally

docs.title: Linux: Permission denied
docs.text:
Solution: 

chmod +x countapp
./countapp

docs.title: App won't start
docs.text: Solutions: 1. Check system requirements are met 2. Try restarting your device 3. Reinstall the application 4. Check for error logs in the app directory

docs.title: Want to build from source?
docs.text: If you prefer building the app yourself (e.g., to modify features), follow the Development setup guide which explains how to use the dev branch and build locally.

docs.title: Counter Types Guide
docs.text: Count App offers two powerful counter types, each designed for specific tracking needs. This guide will help you choose the right counter type and configure it effectively.

docs.title: Quick Comparison
docs.text: Feature Tap Counter Series Counter Icon + / - Chart Color Blue Deep Purple Input Method Single tap Numeric value entry Best For Counting discrete events Tracking measurements over time Update Speed Instant (with optional confirmation) Requires value input Statistics Update frequency, daily counts Averages, trends, highs/lows Chart Type Frequency over time Value trends over time Examples Steps, habits, repetitions Weight, temperature, revenue

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Tap Counter is designed for quick, frequent counting of discrete events. It's perfect when you need to track "how many times" something happens without entering specific values.

docs.title: When to Use
docs.text:
Ideal for:

  • Counting discrete events or occurrences
  • Quick updates without typing
  • Simple increment/decrement tracking
  • Situations where speed is important

Not ideal for:

  • Tracking values that vary significantly
  • When you need to record specific measurements
  • Analyzing trends in numeric values

docs.title: Example Use Cases
docs.text:
• Daily Habits: Water glasses consumed, pages read, meditation sessions
  • Exercise: Push-ups, sit-ups, laps completed
  • Productivity: Tasks completed, emails sent, calls made
  • Tracking: Days since last incident, books finished this month
  • Inventory: Items remaining, stock count

docs.title: Step Size
docs.text:
The amount to add or subtract per tap.

  • Small values (1-5): Precise counting, individual items
  • Medium values (10-50): Grouped counting, batches
  • Large values (100+): Quick accumulation, large quantities

Example: If tracking water intake in 8oz glasses, use step size 1. If tracking in milliliters, use step size 250.

docs.title: Direction
docs.text:
Increment (+): Count up from a starting value

  • Most common use case
  • Examples: Daily steps, completed tasks, money saved

Decrement (-): Count down from a starting value

  • Examples: Days until deadline, items remaining, countdown trackers

docs.title: Require Confirmation
docs.text:
Enabled (default): Shows confirmation dialog before each update

  • Pros: Prevents accidental taps
  • Cons: Slower updates
  • Best for: Important counters, infrequent updates

Disabled: Updates immediately on tap

  • Pros: Faster workflow
  • Cons: Risk of accidental updates
  • Best for: Frequently updated counters, quick tracking

Tip

Disable confirmation for counters you update many times per day (like step tracking). Keep it enabled for important counters that change less frequently.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Series Counter is designed for tracking numeric values that change over time. It stores each value with a timestamp, enabling trend analysis and statistical insights.

docs.title: When to Use
docs.text:
Ideal for:

  • Recording measurements that vary
  • Tracking trends over time
  • Analyzing patterns and statistics
  • Values that need context (date/time)

Not ideal for:

  • Simple counting (use Tap Counter instead)
  • When you don't need historical data
  • Rapid, frequent updates

docs.title: Example Use Cases
docs.text:
• Health Tracking: Body weight, blood pressure, heart rate, temperature
  • Financial: Daily revenue, expenses, account balance
  • Performance: Test scores, workout times, sales numbers
  • Environmental: Temperature readings, humidity levels
  • Personal: Mood ratings, energy levels, sleep hours

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Optional text field to provide context for the counter.

Tips:

  • Include units of measurement (e.g., "in kilograms", "in USD")
  • Mention tracking frequency (e.g., "Daily morning weight")
  • Add relevant context (e.g., "Before breakfast")

Examples:

  • "Body weight in kg (morning, before breakfast)"
  • "Daily revenue in USD"
  • "Resting heart rate (bpm)"

docs.title: Initial Value
docs.text:
The first value in your series.

Best practices:

  • Use your current measurement as the starting point
  • Ensure units match your tracking system
  • Supports decimal values (e.g., 75.5, 98.6)

docs.title: Statistics Available
docs.text:
Series Counters provide rich analytics:

Time-Based Averages:

  • Weekly average (last 7 days)
  • Monthly average (last 30 days)

Extremes:

  • Weekly high and low
  • All-time highest and lowest values

Visualizations:

  • Interactive line charts
  • Time-range filtering (1W, 1M, 3M, 1Y, All)
  • Trend analysis

Note

Series counters store the complete history of values, making them perfect for long-term trend analysis and pattern recognition.

docs.title: Decision Guide
docs.text:
Ask yourself these questions:

  1. Do I need to track specific values or just count occurrences?
  2. Specific values → Series Counter

  3. Count occurrences → Tap Counter

  4. Will I update this many times per day?

  5. Yes, frequently → Tap Counter

  6. No, occasionally → Either works

  7. Do I need to see trends over time?

  8. Yes → Series Counter

  9. No → Tap Counter

  10. Are the values always the same increment?

  11. Yes → Tap Counter
  12. No, they vary → Series Counter

docs.title: Examples by Category
docs.text: Category Use Case Recommended Type Why Health Daily steps Tap Counter Consistent increment, frequent updates Health Body weight Series Counter Values vary, trend analysis needed Finance Cups of coffee bought Tap Counter Counting occurrences Finance Daily expenses Series Counter Values vary significantly Productivity Tasks completed Tap Counter Simple counting Productivity Hours worked Series Counter Values vary, need averages

docs.title: Naming Conventions
docs.text:
Good counter names:

  • "Daily Water (8oz glasses)" - Includes units and context
  • "Morning Weight (kg)" - Specifies timing and units
  • "Work Tasks Completed" - Clear and descriptive

Avoid:

  • "Counter 1" - Not descriptive
  • "Water" - Missing context
  • "Stuff" - Too vague

docs.title: Organization Tips
docs.text:
1. Use consistent naming: Start with category (Health, Finance, etc.)
  2. Include units: Always specify measurement units
  3. Add timing context: Morning, daily, weekly, etc.
  4. Be specific: "Push-ups" not just "Exercise"

docs.title: Data Management
docs.text:
• Regular exports: Back up your data using JSON export
  • Review statistics: Check trends weekly or monthly
  • Clean up: Remove counters you no longer use
  • Document changes: If you change tracking methods, note it in the description

docs.title: Combining Counter Types
docs.text:
You can use both types together for comprehensive tracking:

Example: Fitness Tracking

  • Tap Counter: Daily workout sessions completed
  • Series Counter: Body weight measurements
  • Tap Counter: Glasses of water consumed
  • Series Counter: Resting heart rate

This gives you both frequency data (how often) and measurement data (specific values).

docs.title: Migration Between Types
docs.text:
If you start with one type and realize you need the other:

  1. Export your current counter data (JSON)
  2. Create a new counter of the desired type
  3. Manually transfer key data if needed
  4. Archive the old counter (or delete after export)

Warning

Counter types cannot be converted directly. Plan your counter type carefully based on your tracking needs.

docs.text: • Using the App - Learn how to create and manage counters

docs.title: Leaderboards Guide
docs.text: Compete with friends, family, or colleagues using Count App's leaderboard feature! Create shared leaderboards to track who's leading in habits, fitness goals, or any counter-based competition.

docs.title: What are Leaderboards?
docs.text:
Leaderboards allow you to:

  • Compete with others by sharing counter data
  • Compare rankings in real-time
  • Motivate each other to reach goals
  • Track group progress on shared objectives

Each leaderboard is identified by a unique 6-character code (letters and numbers) that you share with participants.

docs.title: Join or Create a Leaderboard
docs.text:
1. Open the Leaderboards page

  2. Tap the menu icon (☰) or navigate to the Leaderboards section

  3. Tap the plus (+) button to add a leaderboard

  4. Enter leaderboard details:

  • Code: 6-character alphanumeric code (e.g., ABC123)
    • If the code exists, you'll join that leaderboard
    • If it's new, you'll create a new leaderboard
  • Your Name: Display name shown on the leaderboard

  • Attach Counter: Select which counter to share

  • Tap Confirm to join/create

Sharing Codes

Share your 6-character code with others via text, email, or messaging apps so they can join your leaderboard!

docs.title: Code Format
docs.text:
• Length: Exactly 6 characters
  • Characters: A-Z (uppercase letters) and 0-9 (numbers only)
  • Examples: FITNES, WATER1, STEP2K, ABC123

docs.title: Code Behavior
docs.text:
When you enter a code:

  • Code exists: You join the existing leaderboard with other participants
  • Code is new: You create a new leaderboard and become the first participant

Case Insensitive

Codes are automatically converted to uppercase. abc123 and ABC123 are the same leaderboard.

docs.title: What Gets Shared?
docs.text:
When you attach a counter to a leaderboard, the following data is shared:

  • Counter name
  • Current value
  • Counter type (Tap Counter or Series Counter)
  • Last update timestamp

docs.title: Selecting the Right Counter
docs.text:
You can attach any counter you've created:

  • Tap Counters: Compare total counts (e.g., daily steps, water glasses)
  • Series Counters: Compare latest values (e.g., current weight, daily revenue)

Privacy Note

Only the current value and counter name are shared. Historical data and detailed statistics remain private on your device.

docs.title: Accessing Your Leaderboards
docs.text:
1. Open the Leaderboards page
  2. Tap a leaderboard to view details

docs.title: Leaderboard View
docs.text:
The leaderboard shows:

  • Rankings: Participants sorted by counter value (highest to lowest)
  • User Names: Display names of all participants
  • Counter Values: Current value for each participant
  • Counter Names: Name of each participant's attached counter
  • Last Updated: When each counter was last updated

docs.title: Real-Time Updates
docs.text:
Leaderboards automatically sync when you:

  • Open the leaderboard detail page
  • Pull to refresh (swipe down)
  • Update your attached counter

docs.title: Reordering Leaderboards
docs.text:
Organize your leaderboards list:

  1. Long-press the drag handle (≡) on a leaderboard
  2. Drag up or down to reorder
  3. Release to set the new position

docs.title: Updating Your Counter
docs.text:
Your leaderboard ranking updates automatically when you update the attached counter:

  1. Update your counter normally (from the home page)
  2. The leaderboard will reflect your new value on next sync

docs.title: Deleting a Leaderboard
docs.text:
To remove a leaderboard from your list:

  1. Open the leaderboard
  2. Tap Delete on the leaderboard detail page
  3. Confirm deletion

Leaving vs Deleting

Deleting a leaderboard only removes it from your device. Other participants can still see the leaderboard, but your data will no longer be shared.

docs.title: Privacy Considerations
docs.text:
Remember:

  • Anyone with the code can join your leaderboard
  • Your counter value and name are visible to all participants
  • Choose counter names that don't reveal sensitive information
  • Use generic names like "Daily Goal" instead of specific details

docs.title: Quick Start Guide
docs.text: Get up and running with Count App in minutes!

docs.title: Create Your First Counter
docs.text:
When you open the app for the first time, your list will be empty.

  1. Tap the Plus (+) button in the bottom-right corner.
  2. Choose "Tap Counter" (simplest option).
  3. Give it a name (e.g., "Water Glasses").
  4. Tap Save.

🎉 You've created your first counter!

docs.title: Track Something
docs.text:
Now that you have a counter:

  1. Tap the counter card to increment the count.
  2. The number goes up by 1 (or your custom step size).
  3. That's it! The app automatically records the time of each tap.

docs.title: View Statistics
docs.text:
After you've tapped a few times:

  1. Long-press the counter card.
  2. Select "View Statistics".
  3. See your daily activity, trends, and history.

docs.title: Using Count App
docs.text: A comprehensive user guide for everyday use of Count App.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: After installing Count App, you'll see the home screen with your counter list. Initially, this will be empty. Let's walk through the basic operations.

docs.title: Add a New Counter
docs.text:
1. Tap the floating action button (+) in the bottom-right corner of the home screen
  2. Select a counter type:
  3. Tap Counter - For quick counting (steps, water intake, habits)
  4. Series Counter - For tracking measurements (weight, revenue, temperature)
  5. Fill in the configuration form (see below for details)
  6. Tap the save button to create your counter

docs.title: Tap Counter Configuration
docs.text:
When creating a Tap Counter, you'll configure:

Counter Name (required)

  • Choose a descriptive name
  • Example: "Daily Water (8oz glasses)"

Step Size (required)

  • How much to add/subtract per tap
  • Default: 1
  • Example: Use 5 for counting by fives

Direction

  • Increment (+): Count up (most common)
  • Decrement (-): Count down

Initial Count

  • Starting value for your counter
  • Default: 0

Require Confirmation

  • Enabled: Shows dialog before each update (prevents accidents)
  • Disabled: Updates immediately (faster for frequent updates)

Tip

For counters you'll update many times per day, disable confirmation for a faster workflow.

docs.title: Series Counter Configuration
docs.text:
When creating a Series Counter, you'll configure:

Counter Name (required)

  • Choose a descriptive name
  • Example: "Morning Weight (kg)"

Description (optional)

  • Add context about what you're tracking
  • Include units and timing
  • Example: "Daily weight measurement before breakfast"

Initial Value (required)

  • Your first measurement
  • Supports decimals (e.g., 75.5)

docs.title: Update a Tap Counter
docs.text:
1. Tap the counter in your list
  2. If confirmation is enabled, confirm the update in the dialog
  3. The counter value updates immediately
  4. A success message appears briefly

What happens:

  • Value changes by the step size
  • Increment counters add the step size
  • Decrement counters subtract the step size
  • Update timestamp is recorded

docs.title: Update a Series Counter
docs.text:
1. Tap the counter in your list
  2. Enter the new value in the dialog
  3. Supports decimal numbers (e.g., 75.5, 98.6)
  4. Previous value and last update time are shown for reference
  5. Tap OK to save the value
  6. The counter updates with your new measurement

What happens:

  • New value is recorded with current timestamp
  • Value is added to the series history
  • Statistics are automatically recalculated

Note

Series counters store every value you enter, allowing you to track trends over time.

docs.title: Access Statistics
docs.text:
1. Long-press a counter to open the context menu
  2. Select "View Statistics" (or tap the info icon if available)
  3. View detailed analytics and charts

docs.title: Tap Counter Statistics
docs.text:
Available data:

  • Total update count
  • Daily update frequency
  • Most active days
  • Update history timeline
  • Frequency charts
  • Heatmap visualizations:
  • Weekly heatmap (7 days × 24 hours) - shows when you typically update during the week
  • Monthly heatmap (12 months × 31 days) - reveals seasonal patterns
  • Days per update count histogram

docs.title: Series Counter Statistics
docs.text:
Available data:

  • Averages: Weekly and monthly
  • Extremes: Weekly high/low, all-time high/low
  • Interactive charts with time-range filters:
  • 1W (last 7 days)
  • 1M (last 30 days) - default
  • 3M (last 90 days)
  • 1Y (last 365 days)
  • All (complete history)
  • View all updates: Access a complete history of all recorded values with timestamps

Using the chart:

  • Tap the time range buttons to filter data
  • View trends and patterns
  • Identify highs and lows visually
  • Access the full update history to see every data point

Analyzing Trends

Use the time range filters to zoom in on specific periods and identify patterns in your data.

docs.title: Reorder Counters
docs.text:
Organize your counter list by dragging and dropping:

  1. Long-press any counter to enter selection mode
  2. Drag the handle (≡) on the right side of a counter
  3. Move it up or down to your desired position
  4. Release to set the new order

Your custom counter order is automatically saved.

docs.title: Lock/Unlock a Counter
docs.text:
Prevent accidental changes to a counter by locking it:

  • Locked counters display a lock icon next to their name
  • Locked counters cannot be updated or edited
  • To lock/unlock, select the counter and choose the lock/unlock option

Protecting Important Data

Lock counters that track critical data to prevent accidental modifications.

docs.title: Edit a Counter
docs.text:
1. Long-press the counter in your list
  2. Select "Edit" from the menu
  3. Modify the settings (name, step size, etc.)
  4. Save your changes

Note

You cannot change the counter type after creation. To switch types, create a new counter and export/delete the old one.

docs.title: Delete Counters
docs.text:
Delete a single counter:

  1. Long-press the counter you want to remove
  2. Select "Delete" from the menu
  3. Confirm the deletion

Delete multiple counters:

  1. Long-press any counter to enter selection mode
  2. Tap additional counters to select them
  3. Tap the delete icon in the toolbar
  4. Confirm the deletion

Warning

Deleted counters cannot be recovered unless you have a backup export. Always export important data before deleting.

docs.title: Export Counters
docs.text:
Create a backup of all your counters:

  1. Open the app menu (three dots or hamburger icon)
  2. Select "Export Counters"
  3. Choose a save location on your device
  4. Enter a custom filename (optional)
  5. Default: Timestamp-based filename (e.g., 2025-02-05_14-30-00.json)
  6. You can provide your own descriptive name
  7. Invalid characters will be rejected
  8. Save the JSON file

The export file contains:

  • All counter configurations
  • Complete value history
  • Update timestamps
  • All statistics data

File format: JSON (human-readable text)

Tip

Export your counters regularly, especially before app updates or when switching devices.

docs.title: Import Counters
docs.text:
Restore counters from a previous export:

  1. Open the app menu
  2. Select "Import Counters"
  3. Navigate to your backup file (JSON format)
  4. Select the file to import
  5. Choose import mode:
  6. Merge: Add imported counters to existing ones
  7. Replace: Delete existing counters and import

Warning

"Replace" mode will delete all current counters. Make sure you have a backup before using this option.

docs.title: Leaderboards
docs.text: Compete with friends and family by creating or joining leaderboards!

docs.title: Accessing Leaderboards
docs.text:
1. Open the app menu (☰)
  2. Select "Leaderboards"

docs.title: Joining a Leaderboard
docs.text:
1. Tap the plus (+) button on the leaderboards page
  2. Enter the 6-character code (e.g., ABC123)
  3. Enter your display name
  4. Select a counter to attach to the leaderboard
  5. Tap Confirm

docs.title: Viewing Rankings
docs.text:
1. Tap on a leaderboard to view details
  2. See rankings sorted by counter value
  3. Pull to refresh to update rankings

Sharing Codes

Share your leaderboard code with others so they can join and compete with you!

For more details, see the Leaderboards Guide.

docs.title: Naming Conventions
docs.text:
Good names include:

  • What you're tracking
  • Units of measurement
  • Timing context

Examples:

  • "Daily Water (8oz glasses)"
  • "Morning Weight (kg)"
  • "Work Tasks Completed"
  • "Push-ups (per session)"

docs.title: Organization
docs.text:
Keep your counter list organized:

  • Use consistent naming patterns
  • Delete counters you no longer use
  • Group related counters with prefixes (e.g., "Health: Weight", "Health: Steps")

docs.title: Data Management
docs.text:
Protect your data:

  • Export counters monthly
  • Keep backups in cloud storage
  • Test imports periodically to ensure backups work

Review your data:

  • Check statistics weekly
  • Look for patterns and trends
  • Adjust tracking methods if needed

docs.title: Performance Tips
docs.text:
For faster updates:

  • Disable confirmation on frequently-used Tap Counters
  • Use appropriate step sizes (avoid step size 1 if counting by 10s)
  • Keep counter names concise

docs.title: Switch Between Light and Dark Mode
docs.text:
1. Open the app menu
  2. Select "Options"
  3. Choose your preferred theme:
  4. Light mode - bright background, optimized for daylight viewing
  5. Dark mode - dark background, easier on the eyes at night
  6. System default - automatically matches your device's theme setting

The theme applies immediately to all screens.

Quick toggle: Use the Dark Mode switch in Options for instant toggling.

Battery Saving

On OLED displays, dark mode can help conserve battery power.

docs.title: Counter Not Updating
docs.text:
Possible causes:

  • Confirmation dialog was cancelled
  • Invalid value entered (Series Counter)
  • App needs restart

Solutions:

  • Try updating again
  • Check for error messages
  • Restart the app

docs.title: Statistics Not Showing
docs.text:
Possible causes:

  • No data recorded yet
  • Time range filter excludes all data
  • Counter was just created

Solutions:

  • Add some data points first
  • Adjust time range filter to "All"
  • Wait for data to accumulate

docs.title: Import Failed
docs.text:
Possible causes:

  • Invalid JSON file
  • File from incompatible version
  • Corrupted backup

Solutions:

  • Verify the file is a valid Count App export
  • Check file wasn't modified
  • Try a different backup file

docs.title: Data Disappeared
docs.text:
Prevention:

  • Regular exports (weekly or monthly)
  • Multiple backup locations
  • Test restores periodically

Recovery:

  • Import from most recent backup
  • Check device storage for auto-backups (if enabled)
